channel.title: Kept Blog
channel.description: Guides, comparisons, and insights on managing AI conversations across ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. From the team building Kept.

item.title: Getting a Second Opinion from Another AI in 10 Seconds
item.description: You are deep in a ChatGPT conversation and want Claude's take. Today that means 10 minutes of manual context transfer. It should take 10 seconds.

item.title: I Analyzed 6 Months of AI Conversations. Here Is What I Found.
item.description: 2,847 conversations across ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. I tracked every topic, every decision, every tool mentioned. The patterns surprised me.

item.title: How to Share AI Conversation Snippets Without Losing Formatting
item.description: You copy the perfect AI answer, paste it into Slack, and watch the formatting disintegrate. Code blocks flatten. Tables vanish. There is a better way.

item.title: Building a Knowledge Graph from Your AI Conversations
item.description: Your conversations contain decisions, tools, people, and concepts. A knowledge graph extracts them and maps the connections. Here is what that looks like in practice.

item.title: Obsidian, Notion, and Tana: Where AI Conversations Don't Fit
item.description: General PKM tools require manual entry. AI conversations need automatic ingestion, platform-aware parsing, and cross-provider search. The gap is structural.

item.title: How to Search Across All Your AI Conversations
item.description: You use ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini daily. But you cannot search across all of them. Here is why that gap exists, and how to solve it.

item.title: How to Transfer Context Between ChatGPT and Claude
item.description: You built 30 messages of context in ChatGPT and now want Claude's take. Here are the current manual methods and an automatic alternative.

item.title: Kept vs Echoes vs ChatGPT Exporter: Compared
item.description: Export tools, conversation managers, and knowledge platforms. Three approaches to managing AI conversations. Which one fits your workflow?

item.title: Stop Re-explaining Your Codebase to Every AI
item.description: Context templating automatically syncs your codebase with ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. No more copy-pasting project structure into every new conversation.

item.title: CLAUDE.md, llms.txt, and spec.md: Why Developers Are Building Context Systems for AI
item.description: Developers are building manual context files for AI tools. Here is what each format does, where they fall short, and what automated context management looks like.

item.title: Claude for Architecture, ChatGPT for Code: Keeping Context When You Switch
item.description: Each AI model has different strengths for developers. Here is when to use each one, and how to manage context across all of them.

item.title: Why Local-First Matters for Your AI Conversations
item.description: Cloud-first means someone else controls your data. Local-first means you do. For AI conversations that contain your decisions, research, and strategy, that distinction matters.

item.title: The Developer's Guide to AI Model Strengths: When to Use ChatGPT vs Claude vs Gemini vs DeepSeek
item.description: Each AI model has different strengths for developers. Here is when to use each one, and how to manage context across all of them.

item.title: The Context Window Tax: How Copy-Pasting Between Your IDE and Browser Costs You 40 Minutes a Day
item.description: Developers lose 40+ minutes daily on context management. The METR study found AI tools make experienced devs 19% slower. Here is why, and how to fix it.

item.title: Why AI Platforms Will Never Index Each Other (And What That Means for Your Workflow)
item.description: ChatGPT will never search your Claude conversations. Claude will never index your Gemini chats. This is structural, not a missing feature. And the gap widens with every new platform that launches.

item.title: Context Drift Is Killing Your AI Coding Sessions. Here's the Fix.
item.description: AI assistants lose 47% accuracy after 10 turns. Learn how context drift happens, why it destroys productivity, and how to maintain context across long coding sessions.

item.title: Your AI Conversations Are a Codebase
item.description: Developers version control every line of code but treat AI conversations as disposable chat. Those conversations contain the decisions, trade-offs, and reasoning behind the code. It is time to treat them accordingly.
